newsitem.title: USA: Telular Corp sees Hungary hurting results.
newsitem.headline: Telular Corp sees Hungary hurting results.

text.p: Telular Corp, a telecommunications technology company, said Tuesday a slowdown in shipments to a project in Hungary will hurt the company's 1997 and 1998 operating results.
Expected orders of about $48 million will now be $7 to $10 million during that timeframe, the company said.

Orders halted in February after the conclusion of Phase 1 of the project and have not resumed due to adjustments to the cellular infrastructure equipment and corresponding changes required on Telular's fixed wireless terminal, the company said.
Full deployment of Phases 2 and 3 will not be completed during Telular's fiscal 1997 and 1998, the company said.
Telular said it is pursuing other opportunities of similar magnitude which have a potential for fiscal 1998 in Malaysia, China, Pakistan, Guinea, Mexico and Brazil.
Telular shares were down 7/16 at 3-1/8 Tuesday.
